subject: Sleep
title: Irregular Sleep-Wake Rhythm
description: A quick, practical guide to Irregular Sleep-Wake Rhythm.

hook.text: An Alzheimer's patient sleeps in scattered naps throughout the day and night with no recognizable pattern.

buildup.text: Irregular sleep-wake rhythm disorder fragments sleep into three or more periods scattered across 24 hours.

discovery.text: It often results from damage to the SCN or severe weakening of circadian time cues.

twist.text: Neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's frequently damage the SCN directly.

climax.text: Bright light therapy and structured daily routines can partially restore rhythm even in advanced dementia.

punchline.text: When the master clock breaks, sleep shatters into fragments.

quiz.question: What causes irregular sleep-wake rhythm disorder?
options: Damage to the SCN or weakened circadian cues
